commentaries.bbcode: Tidy start by Jayant. Gayle not yet flexing his muscles. Zaheer will share the new ball.

message.text: Tidy start by Jayant. Gayle not yet flexing his muscles. Zaheer will share the new ball.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]18:00 Local: [/b]Here we go again! The rain has started to come down quite heavily. The players scurry off the field and on come the covers. And so the wait begins...

message.text: 18:00 Local: Here we go again! The rain has started to come down quite heavily. The players scurry off the field and on come the covers. And so the wait begins...

commentaries.bbcode: [b]18:15 Local: [/b]I wish I could bring you some good news, but I'm sorry to report that it's raining very hard. The pitch inspection, which is likely to be at about 19:00, will involve some very muddy boots!

message.text: 18:15 Local: I wish I could bring you some good news, but I'm sorry to report that it's raining very hard. The pitch inspection, which is likely to be at about 19:00, will involve some very muddy boots!

commentaries.bbcode: [b]18:30 Local: [/b]The rain is easing up a touch, but everywhere at the Chinnaswamy is completely soaked. If anyone Bangalore fans can get to the ground, take a sponge with you and offer your help!

message.text: 18:30 Local: The rain is easing up a touch, but everywhere at the Chinnaswamy is completely soaked. If anyone Bangalore fans can get to the ground, take a sponge with you and offer your help!

commentaries.bbcode: [b]18:40 Local: [/b]I have exciting news - the covers are coming off! Now the hard work begins for the groundstaff.

message.text: 18:40 Local: I have exciting news - the covers are coming off! Now the hard work begins for the groundstaff.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]18:50 Local: [/b]Yes, as Russel Arnold has tweeted, it will be a 19:00 restart with no overs lost. Let's just hope this pesky rain stays away for good this time.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]19:00 Local: [/b]Just as we were gearing up for the carnage of the chase, the rain decides it wants to take centre stage again. Hugely frustrating.

message.text: 19:00 Local: Just as we were gearing up for the carnage of the chase, the rain decides it wants to take centre stage again. Hugely frustrating.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]19:10 Local: [/b]The rain's getting lighter, but the weather's still looking menacing. We'll keep our fingers crossed this weather passes soon.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]19:15 Local: [/b]It's got heavier folks. Anyone who can lend a ferry to the groundsmen, that would be greatly appreciated, as that's what you'll need at the moment!

message.text: 19:15 Local: It's got heavier folks. Anyone who can lend a ferry to the groundsmen, that would be greatly appreciated, as that's what you'll need at the moment!

commentaries.bbcode: [b]19:30 Local: [/b]Cancel the ferry and call for a submarine - this isn't looking good! However, there will be further cricket today in the Pepsi IPL, regardless of what goes on here, as Sunrisers Hyderabad and Mumbai Indians will lock horns shortly.

message.text: 19:30 Local: Cancel the ferry and call for a submarine - this isn't looking good! However, there will be further cricket today in the Pepsi IPL, regardless of what goes on here, as Sunrisers Hyderabad and Mumbai Indians will lock horns shortly.

commentaries.bbcode:
[b]Match Report: [/b]Royal Challengers Bangalore confirmed their passage to the Pepsi IPL 2015 playoffs after they took one point from their washed-out encounter against the Delhi Daredevils. Courtesy that one point, RCB took their tally of points in the season to 16, enough to confirm a third-place finish in the points table. 
 
 RCB were set a target of 188 after half-centuries from Quinton de Kock and JP Duminy helped the visitors to 187-5. The rains set in during the interval between innings, first delaying the start of the chase, and then again after seven balls had been bowled in the chase. When the rains did not relent and allow the players back onto the field, the match officials had no other option to declare the match as a  No Result . Both teams took home one point from the contest; RCB finished the league season at 16 points, while DD finished at seventh place with a tally of 11 points. 
 
 Earlier in the evening, de Kock, playing his third match of the season, and young Shreyas Iyer helped the visitors to a solid brisk start, scoring 55 runs in 6.2 overs. After a couple of quiet overs initially, de Kock opened his shoulders. The left-hander helped himself to two boundaries in the third over bowled by Harshal Patel and two boundaries in the fourth over bowled by Ashok Dinda. 
 
 Soon after the strategic timeout   which was called for by RCB at the end of the sixth over - Shreyas, who had helped himself to 20 from 17 balls, cut a wide delivery from Patel straight to Chris Gayle at point. de Kock and JP Duminy consolidated the innings further with another 55-run partnership; the former was the dominating partner yet again, this time contributing 36 runs as against Duminy s 17 runs. 
 
 de Kock scored 36 runs off the first 27 balls he faced, before accelerating and scoring 33 runs in the next 12 deliveries. In the ninth over of the innings, he picked up a six and two boundaries off David Wiese, and got stuck into Dinda in the eleventh over, hitting him for two sixes and a four. He was dismissed in the twelfth over, when he didn t pick a googly from Yuzvendra Chahal, attempted to hit over the top, but got the outside edge which was smartly pouched by Virat Kohli running backwards. 
 
 Duminy batted through to the end of the innings and finished unbeaten on 67. The DD skipper consumed 43 balls and hit four boundaries and three sixes. Yuvraj Singh (11 from 7 balls, 1 six) and Saurabh Tiwary (13 from 9 balls, 1 six) were the other notable scorers in the innings. DD finished their twenty overs at 187-5, adding 36 runs in the last three overs. 
 
 For RCB, Harshal Patel was the best bowler of the day; he bowled his four overs conceding 30 runs and picking up two wickets. The leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was the only other wicket-taker for the team; though he was hit for three sixes, he picked up the wickets of a well-set de Kock and the dangerous Yuvraj Singh.

message.text:
Match Report: Royal Challengers Bangalore confirmed their passage to the Pepsi IPL 2015 playoffs after they took one point from their washed-out encounter against the Delhi Daredevils. Courtesy that one point, RCB took their tally of points in the season to 16, enough to confirm a third-place finish in the points table.

RCB were set a target of 188 after half-centuries from Quinton de Kock and JP Duminy helped the visitors to 187-5. The rains set in during the interval between innings, first delaying the start of the chase, and then again after seven balls had been bowled in the chase. When the rains did not relent and allow the players back onto the field, the match officials had no other option to declare the match as a ‘No Result’. Both teams took home one point from the contest; RCB finished the league season at 16 points, while DD finished at seventh place with a tally of 11 points.

Earlier in the evening, de Kock, playing his third match of the season, and young Shreyas Iyer helped the visitors to a solid brisk start, scoring 55 runs in 6.2 overs. After a couple of quiet overs initially, de Kock opened his shoulders. The left-hander helped himself to two boundaries in the third over bowled by Harshal Patel and two boundaries in the fourth over bowled by Ashok Dinda.

Soon after the strategic timeout – which was called for by RCB at the end of the sixth over - Shreyas, who had helped himself to 20 from 17 balls, cut a wide delivery from Patel straight to Chris Gayle at point. de Kock and JP Duminy consolidated the innings further with another 55-run partnership; the former was the dominating partner yet again, this time contributing 36 runs as against Duminy’s 17 runs.

de Kock scored 36 runs off the first 27 balls he faced, before accelerating and scoring 33 runs in the next 12 deliveries. In the ninth over of the innings, he picked up a six and two boundaries off David Wiese, and got stuck into Dinda in the eleventh over, hitting him for two sixes and a four. He was dismissed in the twelfth over, when he didn’t pick a googly from Yuzvendra Chahal, attempted to hit over the top, but got the outside edge which was smartly pouched by Virat Kohli running backwards.

Duminy batted through to the end of the innings and finished unbeaten on 67. The DD skipper consumed 43 balls and hit four boundaries and three sixes. Yuvraj Singh (11 from 7 balls, 1 six) and Saurabh Tiwary (13 from 9 balls, 1 six) were the other notable scorers in the innings. DD finished their twenty overs at 187-5, adding 36 runs in the last three overs.

For RCB, Harshal Patel was the best bowler of the day; he bowled his four overs conceding 30 runs and picking up two wickets. The leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was the only other wicket-taker for the team; though he was hit for three sixes, he picked up the wickets of a well-set de Kock and the dangerous Yuvraj Singh.

commentaries.bbcode: \n\nI'm sorry to say but we've got no more play in Bangalore. Sadly the rain has won the day, but RCB have now booked their spot in the Playoffs. For DD, they'll be frustrated that they couldn't finish their campaign with a win, but they've made progress from last year. This match may have finished as a No Result, but we've got a humdinger between SRH and MI starting very shortly. Warner's won the toss and he's going to give it a biff, so make sure you head over to enjoy that.

message.text: I'm sorry to say but we've got no more play in Bangalore. Sadly the rain has won the day, but RCB have now booked their spot in the Playoffs. For DD, they'll be frustrated that they couldn't finish their campaign with a win, but they've made progress from last year. This match may have finished as a No Result, but we've got a humdinger between SRH and MI starting very shortly. Warner's won the toss and he's going to give it a biff, so make sure you head over to enjoy that.
